title: Jackie Robinson: ‘I Cannot Stand and Sing the Anthem. I Cannot Salute the Flag’
subtitle: African-American baseball pioneer Jackie Robinson wrote in his autobiography that he couldn't sing the anthem or salute the flag because "I know that I am a black man in a white world."
author: David Emery
vclaim: Baseball player Jackie Robinson said, "I cannot stand and sing the anthem. I cannot salute the flag; I know that I am a black man in a white world."
